events.text: I think I'm not the only uncertain one.
People know their jobs are bullshit, and almost no one is being compensated enough to keep up with the cost of living.
Like the water is rising, and everyone can kind of feel this encroaching poverty.
But no one can do anything, but we have a little bit of time left and maybe a little bit of disposable money
Like, not enough to set your life up well or acquire property or get yourself into stability...
but enough to like, go to resturaunts once and a while...
or like go to a park or a casino...
and thats all we can do.
Is indulge in these distractions while we wait for our lives to end...
but not in like a nihilistic "eeeuuughhh we're all gonna die one day man whats the point," no...
I mean like until the cost of living is so high that 20, 30, 45, 70% of people are below the poverty line.
like when shit hits the fan, ya know?
Like the residule safety net, from when opportunity was distributed in a bigone economy, finally dissolves.
